conclusion: Use Snell's Law to solve the problem.
Snell's Law: n1 * sin(i) = n2 * sin(r).
Identify the mediums: light starts in air (n1 ≈ 1) and enters water (n2 ≈ 1.33).
Light travels from point A in the air towards boundary at point O1, then enters water and continues through point B.
Apply Snell's Law at the boundary: light ray changes direction due to refraction at point O1.
If O1 is to the right of O, angle of incidence i is greater than angle of refraction r.
Light ray would bend more sharply entering water if O1 is to the right of O.
Conclusion: If O1 is to the right of O, i > r, light enters water at a steeper angle and bends less steeply.
Final Answer: Yes, O1 point can be to the right of O point.
